alert.note: Alert for Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island; West Coast (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 26 at 12:29PM ADT until March 26 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 6 PM AST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 014, 018, and 027, which includes the southern and western coastal plains of Puerto Rico.. * WIND...Sustained winds around 15 to 20 mph and gusts in sea breeze variations around 25 to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity values near or below 40 possible. * THUNDERSTORMS...None. * HIGHEST THREAT...Across the southwestern coastal plains of Puerto Rico, where the most recent surface observations indicated a maximum sustained wind of 19 mph and a relative humidity value of 46 percent. Given current dry fuels and soils conditions, and strong, gusty winds, any fires that occur are likely to easily spread. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island; West Coast
